metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1303 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A specially crafted HTTP request header could have crashed the Apache HTTPServer prior to version 2.4.30 due to an out of bound read while preparingdata to be cached in shared memory. It could be used as a Denial of Serviceattack against users of mod_cache_socache. The vulnerability is consideredas low risk since mod_cache_socache is not widely used, mod_cache_disk isnot concerned by this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1').
